snippet: As more readers move toward online social networks, and as publishers desperately seek scale to bring in revenue, many have deplored a race toward repetitive journalism.
abstract: Media outlets, seeking to attract large audiences in an online environment dominated by social media, are participating in repetitive coverage of sensationalistic, and often trivial, stories; recent example was death of Cecil the Lion, which caused some 2,100 articles to be posted to Facebook that were then shared some 3.6 million times; some journalists deplore trend, while others see it as necessary to bring audiences to other coverage.
lead_paragraph: As more readers move toward online social networks, and as publishers desperately seek scale to bring in revenue, many have deplored a race toward repetitive journalism.

headline.main: Where Clicks Reign, Audience Is King
headline.print_headline: Where Clicks Reign, Audience Is King
